body.p: Washington, D.C., soldier. Connecticut native. Married to Louisa M. Wright. Father of Mary Wright, Edward Bradford Wright, and Rosa Wright Smith. Graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1841. Assistant Professor of Engineering at West Point from 1842-1884. Appointed a Brigadier General of Volunteers in September 1861, and Major General of Volunteers in July 1862. Chief engineer of Heintzelman's Division at the battle of Bull Run. Brigade commander in Port Royal expedition. 1862, participated in capture of Fernandina, Florida, and commanded a Division in the attack on Secessionville, South Carolina. July 1862, assigned to the Department of the Ohio, and commanded the 1st Division, VI Corps, in the Army of the Potomac at Gettysburg. After General Sedgwick's death, he was in command of the VI Corps, which he led in the Richmond campaign until July 1864. In August to December, he was engaged in the Shenandoah campaign. Where he was wounded in the battle of Cedar Creek. Participated in final military operations which ended with the surrender of Lee. Breveted Major General, US Army, in March 1865. Served as Military governor of Texas until 1866 when he resumed his practice of civil engineering.
